did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Audio Recordings, Computer Media, Correspondence, Financial Records, Legal Documents, Manuscripts, Memorabilia, Newspapers, Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications, Research Materials
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection contains business documents, correspondence, engineering plans and schematics, audio and video recordings, photographs, instruments and instrument components, and other personal papers documenting his work as an engineer and electronic music pioneer.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Robert Moog, founder of Moog Music, was an American engineer and pioneer of electronic music, best known as the inventor of the Moog synthesizer.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection contains business documents, correspondence, engineering plans and schematics, audio and video recordings, photographs, instruments and instrument components, and other personal papers documenting his work as an engineer and electronic music pioneer.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to boxes, 23-25, 51, and 57, as well as folders 36, 40, and 41 of box 58, restricted to the permission of the curator.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on our Reproductions & Permissions page.
Phonograph records in boxes 19 and 71 have been remediated for mold. Consider using nitrile gloves when directly handling.

Mold present in all open-reel tapes and videotapes except the following: tr-16422-16426, 16428-16430, 16436-16437, 16439, 16445, 16465-16466, 16468-16470, 16473-16477, 16480, 16486, V-10451-10453, and V-10871. Individuals with weak immune systems may need to take extra precautions.
Software and digital files stored on obsolete formats are closed to researchers pending digital processing.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Robert Moog papers, #8629. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series IV. Schematics, Circuit Notes, and Layouts

scopecontent.p: Includes college notebooks, personal finance, and articles/notes related to personal interests and activities.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically, except where noted otherwise.

scopecontent.p: Contains bills, check stubs, and bank statements.

accessrestrict.p: Access to box 57 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Contains bills, bank statements, taxes, and life insurance/health information.

accessrestrict.p: Access to box 24 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Includes notebooks, assignments, and readings from Moog's years at Cornell. Includes his 1965 thesis as well as his BA diploma from Queen's College.

arrangement.p: Lecture notes, notebooks, and assignments arranged by course, as per original order.

accessrestrict.p: Access to folders 36 and 40-41 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Contains: articles and notes related to various interests and activities of Moog's including: political organizing with the ACLU; pamphlets from Florence Moog's memorial as well as a selection of her writings; documents pertaining to Moog genealogy; and travel ephemera.

arrangement.p: Arranged by subject.

scopecontent.p: Alphabetical files (boxes 60-61) includes product inquiries, fan mail, catalog requests, invitations, greeting cards, and personal correspondence. Includes handwritten and typewritten letters, faxes, printed emails, photocopies, and carbon copies.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent (or corporate name where applicable).

processinfo.p: Correspondence was removed from envelopes by processing staff. Where letters do not include full dates and/or names, materials were kept in original envelopes.

scopecontent.p: Also includes business cards, address lists, and correspondence with individuals whose last names could not be determined.
Contains correspondence between Florence Moog and various members of the Moog family (including Robert) as well as correspondence between Florence and friends.
Contains correspondence between Moog and various family members, primarily Shirleigh Moog.

arrangement.p: Arranged by year.

scopecontent.p: Includes financial records, meeting notes and minutes, phone logs, production notes and planning, press releases, company newsletters, product manuals and advertisements for companies Moog operated or was employed by.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically.

processinfo.p: In order to preserve the context of materials in this series, correspondence related to business-operations and product development was not moved to the alphabetized Correspondence series.

scopecontent.p: Contains bills, petty cash receipts, and expenditures (1976-1979, 1982-1989).

accessrestrict.p: Access to box 51 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Contains R.A. Moog Co., Moog muSonics, and Moog Music/Norlin business documents, including meeting minutes, press releases, sales reports, memos, phone logs, and documentation of product planning, engineering, and production.

Contains Big Briar, Crumar, Synton, and Kurzweil business documents, including meeting minutes, press releases, sales reports, memos, phone logs, and documentation of product planning, engineering, and production. Also contains 1983-1984 business correspondence.

processinfo.p: 1983-1984 correspondence was originally organized alphabetically in an accordion file labeled "Business Correspondence." Correspondence was removed from the file , but original alphabetical order has been preserved.

scopecontent.p: Contains Big Briar, Kurzweil, and Van Koevering business documents, including meeting minutes, press releases, sales reports, memos, phone logs, and documentation of product planning, engineering, and production.

Contains Big Briar, Van Koevering, and Moog Music business documents, including meeting minutes, press releases, sales reports, memos, phone logs, and documentation of product planning, engineering, and production. Also contains documentation of trademark disputes regarding the Moog company name.
Contains invoices and packing slips (1968-1999) and bills/receipts (1990-2003). Invoices for 1983-1984 are filed in the "Business Correspondence" section of box 48.
Contains owner's manuals, service manuals, and rough drafts of manuals.

arrangement.p: Additional drafts of manuals for certain products are present in Series IV.

scopecontent.p: Manuals (1985-2000, folders 1-15); catalogs, brochures, advertisements, price lists, and newsletters (1957-2011).

arrangement.p: Additional drafts of manuals for certain products are present in Series IV.

scopecontent.p: Poster-sized advertisement for R.A. Moog and Magnetic Recording Systems, Inc (MRS)

Contains financial records, legal correspondence, stock transfers, and other records documenting the sale of Moog to Waytena and subsequently to Norlin. Also contains undated notes and miscellaneous tax documents dated 1980-1999.

accessrestrict.p: Access to box 25 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Contains check stubs and bank statements (1981-1987) and taxes (1976-1982).

accessrestrict.p: Access to box 23 restricted to the permission of the curator.

scopecontent.p: Includes hand drawn and printed schematics, notes, PCB and panel layouts for circuits developed primarily in the 1960s-1970s. Includes custom designs and modifications for individuals including Wendy Carlos, Keith Emerson, Jan Hammer, Eddie Harris, John Eaton, and Max Brand. Includes associated correspondence with collaborators and customers where applicable.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by project/product name, last name (where project was commissioned or collaborated on), or manufacturer (where files are neither Moog nor Big Briar, i.e.. Maestro, Hammond, Fairlight, etc.). Within each subseries files are arranged chronologically.

processinfo.p: Original folders were discarded due to their strong musty odor, though folder titles were transcribed verbatim from Moog's original files.

Items in this series were originally found folded in letter sized folders. Folded items have been removed from their original folders, flattened, and stored in separate oversize folders. In such instances, folders are listed as "Title 1 of 2," "Title 2 of 2," etc. to indicate their original connection.
In some cases loose files were consolidated into project files.
Drafts of product manuals were left in original folders and have not been moved to the manuals series.

Includes articles written by Moog, as well as a complete run of the Moog-published Electronic Music Review (1967-1968). Includes 2 reels of Electronic Music Review microfilm. Issues of Contemporary Keyboard Magazine featuring columns by Moog are located in box 42. Speeches delivered by Moog are filed in their corresponding event file in Series V.

Contains newspaper and magazine clippings of: Moog advertisements, articles about Moog, interviews with/quotes from Moog, and photographs of Moog instruments, collected by both Robert Moog and the Bob Moog Foundation. Also includes articles collected by Moog about electronic music and performers associated with the company, including Wendy Carlos, Lydia Kavina, Clara Rockmore, and Keith Emerson.
